Card-1.title: Harvard's CS50x
Card-1.imgAlt: Landing page for the course, lots of text and a youtube thumbnail of the three teachers.
Card-1.text: One of the best free beginner programming courses. Extremely recommended.

Card-2.title: CS50 Study
Card-2.imgAlt: Students in a study group; sidebar with learning references.
Card-2.text: A good complement to the main CS50x course.

Card-3.title: C: A modern approach
Card-3.imgAlt: Abstract art with random intersecting shapes; book title cover.
Card-3.text: A very, very thorough and verbose book covering the C89/C99 standards.

Card-4.title: The C Programming Language
Card-4.text: A good book for the C language. Recommended but maybe not for complete beginners.

Card-5.title: Wikibooks: C programming
Card-5.imgAlt: Landing page in wiki format with links to different parts of the book.
Card-5.text: A free wikibooks reference and resource for C.

Card-6.title: C Programming tutorial
Card-6.imgAlt: Youtube thumbnail, 'C programming tutorial in one video'
Card-6.text: A 4 1/2 hour video going over the basics of C.

Card-7.title: Freecodecamp: C
Card-7.imgAlt: C language logo and freecodecamp logo; 'C in 4 hours no ads'
Card-7.text: A 4 hour introduction on C by freecodecamp with no ads.

Card-8.title: Computerphile: Pointers
Card-8.imgAlt: Youtube thumbnail, man with glasses and two lego blocks behind him.
Card-8.text: A 20 minute video breaking down and explaining pointers using analogies and imagery. Recommended.

Card-9.title: Computerphile: Recursion
Card-9.imgAlt: Youtube thumbnail, man with glasses and the word recursion in his hand.
Card-9.text: A 10 minute video explaing recursion with imagery and physical examples. Recommended.

Card-10.title: List of C books
Card-10.imgAlt: A comment with lots of text on stack overflow.
Card-10.text: StackOverflow thread full of lots of good C resources, for different levels.
